title: Jerry Rice
summary: Jerry Lee Rice Sr. (born October 13, 1962) is a former football wide receiver who played in the National Football League (NFL) for 21 seasons with the San Francisco 49ers, Oakland Raiders, Seattle Seahawks, and Denver Broncos. He is considered by many the greatest wide receiver in NFL history. He played college football at Mississippi Valley State and was selected by the 49ers in the first round of the 1985 NFL Draft, 16th overall, where he spent 16 seasons. Rice was also a member of the Oakland Raiders and Seattle Seahawks. Due to his numerous records, accomplishments, and accolades, he is widely regarded as the greatest wide receiver in NFL history, and one of the greatest players in NFL history.[1][2][3][4]
